intro: Geogenanthus, commonly known as the golden bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. These plants are native to the Andes mountains in South America, where they thrive in high-altitude, temperate climates. They are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers, which are typically yellow or orange in color. The leaves are usually evergreen and leathery, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of their habitat. Geogenanthus species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
